item.title: Load Balancer vs API Gateway - Understanding the Differences
item.description:

item.title: Personal Knowledge Management with Hugo & Obsidian
item.description:
Prerequisites #

  • Obsidian installed on your machine
  • Basic knowledge of Markdown
  • A GitHub account
  • Hugo installed on your machine (if not, follow the official installation guide)
  • Git installed on your machine

Step 1: Set up GitHub repository #

  1. Create a new repository on GitHub.

    • Go to your GitHub account and create a new repository.
    • Name it <your-username>.github.io (replace <your-username> with your GitHub username). This is important because GitHub Pages uses this naming convention to host user pages.
    • Set it as public and initialize it with a README.md file.

  2. Clone the repository to your local machine.

Check if you have an SSH key #

Run the following command to see if you already have an SSH key:

ls -al ~/.ssh

You should see something like id_rsa and id_rsa.pub. If these files are not present, you’ll need to generate a new SSH key.
